title: Kim Jong-il
summary: Kim Jong-il[lower-alpha 2][lower-alpha 3] (/ˌkɪm dʒɒŋˈɪl/;[2] Korean: 김정일; Korean pronunciation: [kim.dzɔŋ.il];[lower-alpha 4] born Yuri Irsenovich Kim (Russian: Юрий Ирсенович Ким[lower-alpha 5]); 16 February 1941 – 17 December 2011) was a North Korean politician who was the second supreme leader of North Korea from 1994 to 2011. He led North Korea from the 1994 death of his father Kim Il-sung, the first Supreme Leader, until his own death in 2011, when he was succeeded by his son, Kim Jong-un.
